title: Drawing, A Winged Victory Riding a Chariot; A Winged Victory Crowning a River God, Reno; two roundels, ca. 1805
title_raw: A Winged Victory Riding a Chariot; A Winged Victory Crowning a River God, Reno; two roundels
medium: Pen and black ink, graphite on paper
markings: On verso, in black ink: Cooper Union stamp: MUSEUM / FOR THE / ARTS OF / DECORATION / COOPER UNION (Lugt 457c); watermark: horn below "CXI HONIG"
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: A victory riding upon a chariot toward right. A triangular pylon is shown in the right background. Bottom: a flying female genius holds a wreath over a stream god. Both designs are framed by squares with sides divided into 6 parts each in graphite. Graphite marks; captions: Reno [a river, formerly tributary of the Po]; fame della guerre

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, A Winged Victory Riding a Chariot; A Winged Victory Crowning a River God, Reno; two roundels, ca. 1805. Pen and black ink, graphite on paper. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3298
